summary: This is an internal email chain from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY) discussing media inquiries and internal confusion regarding missing video surveillance footage from Jeffrey Epstein's cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) following his earlier attempted suicide. The emails reveal a USAO spokesman may have spoken to the press against direction, and there is internal disagreement about the status of the video evidence.

persons.name: Jason Swergold
persons.role: Assistant U.S. Attorney, Co-Chief of the Narcotics Unit
persons.context: He is the author of several emails in the chain. He provided a statement to the court about the Epstein cell video not being preserved and confronted a colleague who spoke to the press.

persons.name: Jon Bandler
persons.context: A journalist who was in court for the Tartaglione case and is seeking clarification from the USAO about the status of video from Epstein's cell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier and sex offender. The emails discuss the missing video footage from his MCC cell following an earlier attempted suicide.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: An inmate who was Epstein's cellmate at the MCC. His lawyer raised the issue of the missing Epstein cell video in court.

connections.description: Tartaglione was Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).
Swergold, as a prosecutor, is responding to media inquiries from reporter Jon Bandler regarding statements made in court about evidence.

events.title: Tartaglione Court Hearing
events.description: A court hearing for inmate Tartaglione where his lawyer raised the issue that video from Jeffrey Epstein's cell following an earlier suicide attempt was not preserved.

events.title: Epstein's Earlier Attempted Suicide
events.description: A prior suicide attempt by Jeffrey Epstein while in custody at the MCC, which was the subject of the missing video surveillance.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY)
keyFacts: Internal USAO emails reveal confusion and potential miscommunication about the status of video surveillance from Jeffrey Epstein's MCC cell following an earlier suicide attempt.
A USAO spokesman reportedly confirmed to the Daily News that tapes were missing, which an internal email states was done 'against my direction'.
Prosecutor Jason Swergold told the court, 'It's our understanding...that the video no longer exists, it was not preserved,' indicating the evidence was lost.
The issue of the missing video was raised in court by the lawyer for Epstein's former cellmate, inmate Tartaglione.
